website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, well-made grooming tool that's ideal for problematic issues such as mats in long, coarse fur. However, it's not the best option if you are looking for a traditional rake design.
pros: Ideal for medium to long haired coats, thanks to the long, serrated teeth constructed of durable stainless steel
Works well for coarse fur and for removing large tangles and knots
Many users say it works well for both cats and dogs
cons: Extra care must be taken when using it, as the edges of the teeth are quite sharp
Takes a while to feel confident using it

customer_reviews.title: Goldendoodle miracle product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Goldendoodle grooming miracle!!! I spread some peanut butter on a glass door and removed a brown grocery bag worth of mats from my goldendoodle. With the peanut butter, he didn’t even care. And this pup’s groomer requests that he gets sedated prior to his appointments. Every doodle owner should gave this product. Really works, tight curls and all!!
customer_reviews.author: Chong Factor

customer_reviews.title: Get this if you have a long haired animal!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews, but had to for this. I have a Wheaten Terrier who has long hair & tends to get dreadlocks & crazy mats. This comb went through those knots like a hot knife through butter... I did her ears, her muzzle, & her tail all in 5 minutes with no flinching from my uber sensitive girl. Left all the trimmed hair for the birds to use in their nests. Awesome & easy!
customer_reviews.author: Helene

customer_reviews.title: He looks awesome and he knows it
customer_reviews.text: our Himalayan cat, Dusty, has hair problems every spring...not this year! This de matting comb works! He looks awesome and he knows it!
customer_reviews.author: V. Gonwa

customer_reviews.title: OMG, I'm bleeding!
customer_reviews.text: When I used this product I was injured. The metal piece of the comb located near the top of the comb sliced my thumb. The cut is similar to a straight edge knife cut. I contacted Amazon to aware them of this occurrence. I have used other Sahari pet tools throughout the years and never experienced this before. Because I am a huge fan of the Safari flea comb I have purchased Sahari products expecting a positive result.
customer_reviews.author: Saundra Aloah-Yvonne Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A perfect product for my Newfie!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 10 stars if it were an option. I have a Newfoundland with massive amounts of hair hat requires frequent grooming. She get hair mats built up in areas of friction - armpits, behind her ears, her rump, and throughout her chest. This comb glides through those mats and works them right out! Even ines that develop right up to her skin! I have two other safari products I use in her and my grooming supplies are complete! The prongs on this comb were a little frightening to me at first but after just one use I had it down to a science!
customer_reviews.author: Deniece Beekman

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is really made for a large dog that is matted. Be carful with this the blades are extremely sharp and it cut my dog requiring vet attention. If you use this only comb the matte itself keep it away from the skin area of contact. I thought I was using it correctly unknowing it cut my dog and I quickly called my vet. My dog healed up and she is doing great!
customer_reviews.author: Chip Lister

customer_reviews.title: Holy Grail Product For My Long Haired Siberian Forest Cat
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews so the fact that I am writing one really means this product is AMAZING! I have a Male long haired Siberian Forest cat who recently started getting a ton of mattes fur to the point I was going to take him to the vet to shave his fur in some areas but instead I ordered this and I removed all of the matted fur by myself! My cat did not mind the tugging and sometimes if the dematting comb didn't completely pull out the matted clump itself, it would completely shred it apart so I could easily cut them out. Love this product! 👏🏼
customer_reviews.author: Hammad

customer_reviews.title: Great for dematting, but what about replacement blades?
customer_reviews.text: This de-matting comb works wonderfully! For the price I bought two. We have had another brand for years but the blades had become dull and useless. I gave it a four because it looks as if there is a nut at the top that, if unfastened, would allow the blades to be changed, as was the case with our old one. However, I could not find blades for the old one, nor replacement blades for this one, which is why I bought two. Is there anywhere on-line where I can buy replacement blades for this comb?
customer_reviews.author: penney annie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome brush for my poodle mix
customer_reviews.text: This brush has done wonders for my Minature Aussiedoodle’s grooming. She had so many little matted spots eventhough I brush her every few days. Other brushes tugged the matted sections and definitely didn’t feel good. This brush is SHARP. I have nicked my knuckles multiple times and let me tell you, it stings. This has gotten all the matted knots off my little one and has helped with my Alaskan Malamute’s tail which dreads with every shake she takes. 10/10 would recommend.....with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Spinelli

customer_reviews.title: Got the mats out!
customer_reviews.text: We just got a little Shih Tzu, he's too young to go to the groomer. He's developed mats because people (mainly our toddler) love rubbing on him and petting him. The breed has very silky fine hair similar to a human. I am sure glad I bought this because it removed 90% of the mats. Some mats that were small would make it past the blades, but if I were careful holding the hair/mat I could cut it off with the blades. Be careful using as there is not much protection from the blades especially when removing the hair. Definitely not recommended for children to use. This comb will be a good addition in the doggy care and grooming routine!
customer_reviews.author: o0Loryn0o

customer_reviews.title: For my mini schnauzer
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my mini schnauzer's jaw area was really matted. It might have been from playing with the other pup. Anyway I didn't want to cut them out because I was uncomfortable getting close to her with scissors and I wanted her to keep hair there. The slicker i have she hates and I couldn't get close enough to demat her. Even when i do it just pulls on her and she tries to bite it. So I bought this. It came super fast, and I was able to get all knots out her face. She still has some mats on the back of her leg but it's almost all gone. This is soo helpful
customer_reviews.author: AuroraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is not what I thought it was so it's ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I thought it was so it's not really the fault of the seller or the product. Be careful when using this as those are serrated edges on each one of those individual blades - little knives - and you are basically giving the hair a razor cut with these. I really didn't look too hard before I started using them on my dog's knotted up tail and thinned-it out more than I anticipated. Plus, I cut the bejeesus out of my finger. Completely my fault, but...oh, well. I will pay closer attention in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well on small mats not too close to the skin. Did not work at all on larger mat.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for our older, long-haired, cat. Despite frequent brushing, he still develops mats on his chest. I used it on a couple of small mats - did very well. When I went to larger mat, it was impossible to remove with this dematter. It tugged and pulled, but nothing else. I tried a small, sawing, motion as I tried to work the mat out. Still no success. In the end, I had to use scissors to get the mat out. I gave it three stars because it worked very well on small mats which were not too close to the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Kayce Cawthon McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend! You Can pay more, but why waste money?
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't look that intimidating. My doodle that mats easily has needed this. He mats over night right to the skin. This tool is Such high quality for the price, it can't be beat! Just use the blade cover the Second youre done using it. I left it off during a grooming session and accidentally knocked it off on the carpet and accidentally stepped on it lacerating my Heel. Easy to get fingers cuts too if not held correctly. Fantastic tool, just go slow and be careful/conscientious when using it. I use it with Cowboy Magic and my doodle has avoided Many a clipper stripping (in spite of me brushing twice daily).
customer_reviews.author: Sharece

customer_reviews.title: Must have brush for rough coats!
customer_reviews.text: Having a chow chow I don't know what I would do with out this brush. I don't think it will do much on dogs that don't have rough coats that mat, but this brush is amazing on knots that form around her collar or wherever! The teeth get right under the knots and just start cutting them out. Great. Get it. Worth 3x the price. (And puts the furminator to shame for deep coats). I do think you need a normal wire brush to use in conjunction with it though.
customer_reviews.author: lunasera

customer_reviews.title: No more tangles!
customer_reviews.text: Three cheers for this dematting comb! My mini schnauer used to *hate* getting brushed! He'd throw a small temper tantrum every time I tried to work out his tangles! Not anymore with this dematting comb! I use this comb all over his hair to work out the big tangles and follow that up with a soft brush. The whole process takes less than 5 minutes! Both me, and my pup, are happy with this comb!
customer_reviews.author: ayannah

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but not for a Viscous Cat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cut through matted fur on my long haired cat. Evil Kitty is 16 years old, diabetic, and is no longer grooming herself. Her fur had become badly matted. This is a great product, but unfortunately I was unable to cut through her matted fur because Evil Kitty is extremely viscous, and after being severely bitten, & scratched I gave up. I didn't want to cause her any more stress either. I wound up having to bring her to our Vet, and had her anesthetized and shaved. I still recommend it highly for use on a dog, or a very calm cat. It is a well made product and very comfortable in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tisinger

customer_reviews.title: Left handed directions needed
customer_reviews.text: I think the directions for use are really poor. There r no directions for changing the handle for left handed use. This is extremely frustrating where the pkg says for left or right handed use! There is no way to contact the manufacturer that i can find! I want to use this safely & lack of instructions make this extremely diffiicult & should be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Berkoff

customer_reviews.title: LIFESAVER for Goldendoodle Owners
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for 6 months now - but only pulled it out for the first time tonight. 8 month old Goldendoodle pup is about two months behind on her grooming thanks to COVID, and although we brush her every night, I found matts tonight. A lot of them. Huge bummer. Remembered I had this tool, and twenty minutes later all matting was gone. I rushed to write a review (which I never do) - it was literally that good. I will say I had a partner in the process and I wouldn't have been able to control her and get them out, so that's something to think about but this thing is a LIFESAVER.
customer_reviews.author: SRME

customer_reviews.title: Great product highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I recommend it absolutely love it my dogs are 11,15,pounds I purchased the medium size n I love it . Be gentle but it works very well . I use 3 different elements. I brush the hair on regular dog hair brush and then I use this one and it does the job. I also use a comb . You don’t need to use does elements. My dogs have a lot of hair Shitzu so that’s why I use 3 but sometimes I use this alone always have proper scissors on hand .. knots do form . But since I’ve been using this the knots are not as bad plus you have to groom your dog Atleast 2x a day..
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: A must for thick wavy haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased multiple grooming tools and detangling solutions for my two Hungarian Kuvasz dogs, yet I was still having issues keeping my youngest pup from having issues with knots in her fur. Her fur is extremely thick and wavy. Nothing solved the problem except for this! I still use the $70 and $90 furminatores on other dogs but this tool is great for her coat. It actually thins it out and makes her feel so much softer and had totally eliminated all of the matting issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: This thing ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: A MUST HAVE for long haired dog owners. I have a Bernese Mountain Dog/Border Collie mix and his butt hair is so THICK and long that it mats very easily and causes him discomfort which he then rubs his butt on the floor resulting in thicker matting causing more discomfort. I used to think my only option was to shave it off and start new. But this dematting comb is AWESOME. Gets through the thickest and tightest of mats and the best part is it doesn't make that scary buzzing sound that my guy shakes in fear over. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Great value, works well, be careful with sharpness
customer_reviews.text: Works really well but takes a bit of practice. There is a place to put your thumb to grip it properly, however it took my a few grooms to master not (lightly) slicing my hand on the comb bc it is very sharp when it first arrives. I groom my shihtzu every 2 weeks, it has been around 6months and I am repurchasing this brush as it has become slightly dull. You could probably use for a full year if you wanted. Tip: it really helps to keep the coat healthy and shiny to prevent mattes! Adding olive oil to her food really helped.
customer_reviews.author: Janli Gwo

customer_reviews.title: WHERE HAS THIS BEEN MY WHOLE LIFE???
customer_reviews.text: I have a 13 year old Chow mix, for whom grooming has always been a struggle. I've had some success with various wide tooth undercoat rakes but most do not really penetrate her top coat to successfully remove undercoat (the part that sheds out in poofs in the spring!) we've had mats and hot spots, and she hated grooming because other brushes that caught in her top coat pulled too much. Well, I bought this for my Great Pyrenees, but it's amazing on my Chow! I wish I had found it 12 or so years ago!
customer_reviews.author: A. Atchley

customer_reviews.title: No more leg/paw matts!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how well this was going to work but we decided to order it and give it a try since it was recommended on so many dog sites for longer hair breeds. We have a Golden Mountain Doodle and his legs & paws get super matted when he gets his hair wet outside which is constantly! I ended up cutting chunks of it off before the purchase of this comb. No more of that! This comb works GREAT! Super impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kemph

customer_reviews.title: saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this thing saved mine and my dogs life. I have a Maltese Bichon mix and his hair gets knotted so fast! I brush him and he cries because of all the knots. This completely changed grooming time for us. He chills while I brush him and he doesn't cry at all. Only thing is be careful because it is VERY sharp. He moved once a bit too quickly and I nicked his ear a bit. There was a tiny paper cut type cut and it got better within minutes, but I felt REALLY REALLY bad when it happened. But I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Manifa S.

customer_reviews.title: amqzong product saved my dogs long coat!
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well! My dog has a long hair coat. And we’ve been soo busy lately I missed a couple brushing sessions. I was contemplating just shaving the mats out but figured I would try this first since her coat is so long. It worked amazing! My dog didn’t mind at all and she looks good as new after a 20 minute session. Brushed her out and I’m a happy customer. It works out the mats and cuts through them easily. Pain free for my girl and we got to save her beautiful coat! Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Contra

customer_reviews.title: Very effective on long haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: Really helped with severe matting on my long haired Pomeranian. I worked slowly over several days of short combing sessions. The top edge of the blades are very sharp and cut-through matts from the bottom-up. You can reduce discomfort for the dog by nibbling from the top and edges of the matt until you can finally get through the center. It takes a while but it does work. It seems fairly painless to the dog IF you are careful, slow, and gentle. Don't assume you can just slice through the matt with one pull - that's unrealistic and would cause pain to the dog by pulling on the hair and skin.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Tame Those Labradoodle Dreads
customer_reviews.text: Very good de-matter. I have a tuxedo labradoodle that gets matts that look like dreadlocks. I haven't been that great at keeping her brushed because I also have other dogs, kids, house, job...You know, a life. This product will certainly help me stay in top of keeping her de-matter. I will admit I ended up shaving her pretty short to start fresh, and because once it hits 80 degrees, she's suffering. This comb is sharp and I have cut myself every time I've used it so far (Learning curve), but it works very good.
customer_reviews.author: R. Revell

customer_reviews.title: Who said hair !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after receiving the results of the 🧬 genetic test : Pyrenees - Saint Bernard - Golde retriever mix. The ball of hair was only after 10 strokes. 😅. We brushed our dog every day and dematting every week but never got this fast results and amazing result . Ps: I am left handed a I can change the direction of the blade and other extra perk
customer_reviews.author: dang

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC COAT SAVING DEVICE!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Pomeranians and this comb is a miracle coat saving device!!! My little girl had some serious mats (from when she was blowing her coat) and I thought for sure she would have to be shaved. But oh no!!!!! I ordered this product and it removed the mats...EASILY!!! One little pointer I would like to mention- It is extremely sharp! Please make sure you are paying attention when you use it because I cut my finger! Nothing serious, just proceed with care and make sure you do NOT use it like a regular comb. Just hold your fingers above the mat and carefully work your way through it. The mats will come out very easily- AMAZING!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carmela Velvet

customer_reviews.title: Pefect tool for the job. Highly dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: This de-matting comb has razor sharp blades. Use extreme caution! and do not let your attention wander. Not for use by children!!! now that you have been warned, this is a great little tool. If you have a long haired dog that gets tangles or out in the brush and gets those pesky seeds that will not turn loose of their hair, this is the tool for you. Just keep some sense about you and keep the blades pointed AWAY from the dog and your fingers away from the blades. I have read some of the statements about harming the dog.... that is the fault of the user. My opinion. Wonderful product... be safe!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: I think it is a must have tool...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite grooming tool! I have other dematting rakes and this one is by far the best tool for my ShihTzu and Maltese. I can even rake out their mustaches. You can be gentle or aggressive, but I suggest being gentle. With a minute's patience you can work even the largest mat out. The cutting edge is long and tapered with a serated-ish edge. The tips are smooth and gently glide across the skin. I have used it on my own scalp to experience what my dogs would feel. No objections here.
customer_reviews.author: Househound

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I quickly opened the package without reading anything or realizing that the blades are sharp enough to cut skin. I cut my thumb running it along the blade to remove hair. I have a small wheaten terrier. Does she like this thing? No. When I hit tangles, she reacts by dropping to the ground and trying to roll away from it. But it will go through the tangles if I can get to them and if I go slowly to avoid pulling her hair.
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: My small (toy) dog hated this but she does not like even a soft brush. She has very thick, fast growing hair, so I wanted to try this, but I confess to low expectations. For a different dog or cat it might be just fine. I have another dog of the same breed who tolerates it better, and it does work. For some reason, his coat is not as heavy or fast growing, so I don't need it for him as much. I think it just depends on the animal, and I suspect it would work better for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy O.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: our poor goldendoodle had tons of mats from neglectful brushing on our part. This brush quickly and easily got them ALL out, even the ones close to the skin. Our boy loved being brushed and we have learned our lesson and now brush him regularly with a slicker brush and bust this bad boy out in the event we find another mat on him. Be CAREFUL!! These blades are SHARP and if you're not careful you might slip and nick yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Matty B

customer_reviews.title: My poor poodle..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Toy poodle because he doesn’t shead and becomes a matted mess. Well, because he doesn’t shead this comb was pulling his hair. This would work great for a dog that naturally sheads. I wouldn’t recommend this for a Poodle, or a dog that doesn’t shead. It did assist in getting the mats out of his fur at a coat. He looked so miserable when I was using this on him. Choose wisely.
customer_reviews.author: David Escobedo

customer_reviews.title: Incredible! Wish I had found this YEARS ago!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very very touchy west highland terrier who likes going to the groomer like having a tooth pulled. Because of this, he has very very long hair which has matted in many sensitive areas (under arms, feet, ears, mouth). This tool has been incredible... it has very sharp edges on one side so be very careful when using (I cut my thumb badly when removing hair from the tool, but it was user error) - these razor sharp edges cut through matted fur by gently working it through the affected area. I've carefully used it around his mouth, but the major wins were legs/under arms.
customer_reviews.author: Avndra

customer_reviews.title: A godsend for dogs with curly hair!
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been the only thing that has helped keep my mini Goldendoodle’s luscious curls matt-free!! I had tried other “rake” style ones but they always got stuck in his hair. The serrated blades of this breeze right through any matts that the slicker brush can’t get through. It’s also great because it’s thinner blades can go deep almost to the skin where trouble spots usually form around his ears and paws. Amazing product and a must-have, especially for curly haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush if you know what you’re doing!
customer_reviews.text: I love these for dematting and removing impacted undercoat on dogs, as a groomer this brush is a real time saver. Just take your time and be careful! The blades are very sharp and can cut you or the animal if you aren’t careful! I’ve been using this for a long time, and still manage to get myself every once in a while!
customer_reviews.author: CrazyBird

customer_reviews.title: mats the size of rabbits
customer_reviews.text: this thing is amazing! I have an extremely furry Australian Shepherd who is prone to mats behind his ears and the back of his legs. this comb cut through the mats with complete ease. it's extremely sharp so you have to be careful not to graze their skin, but if you pay ANY attention, that's not a problem at all. it combed through the rest of his leg hair to make it tangle free and far less messy. so pleasantly surprised! we now have a small dog sized fur ball on our floor that I couldn't be happier about 😂
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and a Game Changer!!
customer_reviews.text: This lil comb is amazing and a game changer when grooming my English Shepherd Max. His intense undercoat and long hair is prone to matting within days and this comb has eliminated the need for clippers on the matted areas. I have to groom him at home due to his anxiety and being nicked several times at the groomers. Be careful though when using. It's super sharp and when pulling the hair off the comb be very careful as I sliced my thump up a few times. I also sliced the side of my ring finger as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brigette Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't seem to work for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of the comb, but it doesn't work on my dogs. They are fine haired mixed breeds. Even when I hold the hair at the base of the mat, pulling the blades through the mat still hurts them. I can't figure out how to get rid of their mats with this comb. I resorted to brushing the dogs as best as I could, and used a regular fine toothed comb to isolate the mats and cut them off with a grooming scissors.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: If you are a groomer, you need this in your arsenal!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product before and now purchased one for my groomer. I love that these comb blades are approximately 1.5inches for getting into longer coats to de-mat. This product is WONDERFUL for Labradoodles, Goldendoodles, and other pups. I appreciate the thumb plate so you can adequately apply pressure to rip through the mats and it protects your hands for the blades. My groomer had been using one of those smaller combs that just curved out and it was taking her forever and causing a lot of frustration. She was singing her praises by the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: This tool is a God-send!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 Great Pyrenees dogs with heavy thick coats. We started off with a different deshedding tool that cost $50+ but it couldn't get through their fur & it took us HOURS to groom the dogs. A friend highly recommended this Safari de-matting tool and it's a God-send! It's easy to use, comfortable to hold & grip, you can easily switch the blade around if you're left handed - which 2:5 of my family members are, it runs smoothly through the dog's coat without tugging them. It has shortened our time spent brushing the dogs by 2/3rds! Get this tool - it won't break the bank & you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BETH D

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a miniature schnauzer and he gets the worst tangles on his belly, legs, and around his mouth! I’ve tried all the detangling sprays and brushes and this is the only one that works! It basically cuts through the tangle so be careful and go slow. I try to put my fingers above the tangle and slowly pull through to protect my dog’s skin. Especially when I use it on his little beard. It’s helped so much! Now the groomer doesn’t have to strip him every time I bring him in.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: A magically easy painless way to remove dogs' furry knots!
customer_reviews.text: This little comb is magic! Our standard poodle gets "knots" all the time. It's hard to untangle her fur and not hurt her. This amazing de-matting comb removes the knotted fur with no pulling or hurting. It just glides through the knots and removes them! You need to use the comb with the smooth side of the tines touching your dog's skin. Read the short directions before using it.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Dog rake comb
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a very soft undercoat and gets knots under his legs and others areas when he wears his harness for walks. I only use this if the know is close to the skin so I don't pull and hurt my dog. It works up great to break the knots up so they can easily be combed out with no pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Big fluffy dog friend
customer_reviews.text: We have always had short haired dogs but several of our fosters have long hair and they always came to us a matted mess. We found this and it has been the greatest gift to all of us. It works like magic to get the ma ts out of fur and if you start furthest from the dogs skin, and gently work your way in, there is no discomfort, even with the biggest and tightest mats.
customer_reviews.author: SH03

customer_reviews.title: Amazing grooming equipment for under $8!!!
customer_reviews.text: Holy poop, where has this been for the last year of my life??? I have 3 dogs, 2 of which are low maintenance. The other is a big girl goldendoodle. I felt guilty like I was a bad momma & hadn’t realized just how matted my girl’s fur was. Have a grooming appointment coming up this week & felt very guilty & sad that we would need to shave my doodle down. Received this Safari dematting comb today combed away softly & patiently on & off all day. NO matting left! Only silky, soft hair! This is a MUST HAVE for goldendoodle owners!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built
customer_reviews.text: I have two long-haired cats and both had huge clumps of tangled hair all over. They were too thick for the Safari tool to work on its own, but over time and using a mix of the Safari tool and scissors, I was able to declump both cats. So it did end up helping a lot, but it did not in and of itself clear the clumps. It was a long process and simple scissors were at least as big a reason why my cats are clump free. But the tool helped.
customer_reviews.author: mjb

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I have a pomeranian who gets matted behind his ears. I don't take him to the groomer any more as he has a heart condition and he gets too nervous This comb works through the mats but is very sharp and in my opinion dangerous. It pulled out some of his hair and when I removed it from the comb it sliced my thumb. I'm glad it was me that got hurt and not my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Vonnie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for dematting!
customer_reviews.text: Let me telling you this product has changed brushing time with my dog. I used to fight to keep her still while I worked the Matt's out. Now brushing is just snuggle time. This cuts through the mats so they just come right out and my pup stays calm and relaxed. I will warm you though it is very sharp! I did slice my finger open when I reached for it and tapped the blade my accident. It's like a comb with a blade on one side.
customer_reviews.author: QuelFace

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for professional groomers.
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize how useful de-matters were until I used my co-workers safari brand one. Turns out.. the de-matting tools I had were just not very sharp. This thing is incredible, and will comb out even the thickest mats. I wish I could go back in time and purchase this when I first started grooming. Would have saved me a few hundred hours.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Burdett

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for removing mats
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what my little Havanese fur ball needed! He has the thickest, cottony undercoat I have ever seen! He mats just looking at him. It took me a little bit to figure out how best to use it. Start slow, combing just the top layers moving deeper as you go. If it pulls then just back up a bit and start again. No need to "rake" through. Got through his mats without a struggle. I have purchased the same tool by another manufacturer. This one is much sharper! So glad I decided to try it!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn - Sewhopeful22

customer_reviews.title: It work's, but not on the dog I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: This item work's at softening my long wire haired doxies fur, and getting clumps out of my Pomeranian's fur pretty well, and getting rid of the extra hair that my lab is shedding, but my Chi/Shitzu mix has long soft baby fine fur that's thick and mat's like crazy, and this didn't work to well for her. I'll give it a 5 for working for my other dog's, but chose to give only 4 because it didn't work for the dog I mainly bought it for. It is a nice item though, came on time and undamaged. I recommend this on dog's with courser fur, but don't recommend it on very baby fine fur like my chi/shitzu mix.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Jones

customer_reviews.title: This comb is GREAT on matted dog hair!!
customer_reviews.text: This comb is amazing on small & large dreadlock tangles in our dogs’ fur. We spend a lot of time outside, in the woods & in the lake & our dogs get tangles & knots. This tool is quite sharp & we are able to comb out the knots which we used to have to cut out with scissors. One of our dogs (poodle/deerhound/husky) has a rough wire double coat which dreads quickly & our other dog (english setter) has a silky coat with super long hair on his tail & legs. This comb works great on both of our dogs tangles!
customer_reviews.author: Sidhe

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like this. I wish the teeth were a little closer together and thinner. With a better thumb holder. The thumb holder isn’t in the best spot to fit and keep ur fingers safe. The blades are far apart and miss mats once they are smaller. Hard to dig the blades down when they are close to the skin. Yes I use it. Yes I’ve been cut. Yes I would recommend for hard to rip apart mats. This is the best tool I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: ... the comb I rely on when when grooming my beautiful Wheaten Terrier
customer_reviews.text: This is the comb I rely on when when grooming my beautiful Wheaten Terrier, whose hair gets tangled & matted by merely looking at it. I'd be in a real fix without this comb. The blades can be reversed in this comb so it can be used either left or right handed. I find it convenient to use both hands while combing, but in order to switch hands, the blade needs to be reversed which is time consuming and a bit of a hassle. I intend to buy a second comb and preset one for the left and the other for the right hand.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon

customer_reviews.title: Best tool for long hair
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best find for my Soft-coated Wheaten Terrier! She gets so matted when I try to keep her hair longer during cold months, especially her legs. She loved being brushed, except her legs! This has always been an issue, until now. She doesn’t mind this tool at all unless I occasionally pull her hair. It has been wonderful and I cannot believe the mats I am able to remove without cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This thing saved me from having to shave my dog. Because it's the cold winter months we let his hair grow (he's a Yorkie/Shih tzu mix) and he started getting some matted hair where his harness/collar would be and around his legs and tail. Could not get it out with a brush alone. Just watch your fingers. This thing is SHARP. I managed to cut my finger on it pretty good. But still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Good, gentle comb for dogs and cats
customer_reviews.text: This is a good de-matting comb. I also own a Furminator, but my animals (one dog and six cats) definitely prefer this comb. The Furminator does remove more hair, but sometimes it feels like it is pulling the hair out, rather than combing it out. This does a good job of taking my dog's undercoat out when she is shedding. For the cats, I regularly comb them with this to prevent any matting. I try to do it daily. Be careful to hold the comb in the proper direction. The sharp-bladed side goes up when you're combing.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: The tool works reasonably well, the problem I have with it is the width between blades, which is just to much. It's helpful if the tangle is very large, but overall only useful with other tools. Another problem is the blades are dull, so a wide comb could be just as effective, or in this case ineffective. I would personally try a different product, and would not recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: No more matts, this tool is genius!
customer_reviews.text: Omg, this brush is amazing! My little terrier had so many matts in his fur and this tool works so well! When I ordered it, I was afraid it might be too harsh for a little dog who doesn't shed, but it's been fine. (He's a Biewer Terrier and is only 9 lbs.) It doesn’t cause him any pain at all. He squirms, of course, so I’m trying to get him to associate it with treats. ;) He has a grooming appointment this week and now I don't have to worry about getting charged extra for matt removal, woo hoo! Highly recommend. This is something I've needed for a LONG time!
customer_reviews.author: HaileyNicole

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I've ever tried for a long-haired dog!
customer_reviews.text: We've tried all sorts of brushes and combs but usually end up resorting to a wide-mouth comb and scissors during bath time to deal with matting. Our poor dog's hips and tail were so matted I was about to resort to shaving her fur to get ahead of them again. This tool worked well! It definitely took time for me to work through them all but it was less traumatic for her and less painful than having them pulled by brushes and combs. Will definitely use daily to keep ahead of them now!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Dix

customer_reviews.title: It's Works, Without Causing Your Furbaby Pain!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this De-Matting Comb for my 1year old Shorkie. His fur is pretty thick & smooth. Kids gave bath & didn't brush out. He's had some matting & shedding every since. One stroke of this comb he was nervous but relaxed once we both discovered there was no pain. On the under belly I do hold my fingers to grip closer to the skin before I comb through. The matter for just smoothly comes right out. I was pleasantly surprised. I also sprayed on detangling spray first (Bio Silk) and purchased the 7inch steel comb to assist. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome comb!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this comb gets so much matted fur out and it doesn’t bother either one of our Great Pyrenees! They end up falling asleep while I’m brushing them, which is fantastic! One thing I don’t really like about the comb is that it’s not ambidextrous friendly, unless you physically take the comb apart to switch around the handle every time you want to change brushing hands. It would be nice if you could easily use it in either hand without having to take the comb apart. Regardless, the comb is great!
customer_reviews.author: benjamin dunn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality dematting comb!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the recommendation of my breeder. I have a standard poodle and a toy poodle, and occasionally they get a matt or two. This is really good quality dematting tool. Be really careful because it is really sharp. Use it very sparingly or your fur baby will have choppy areas in their fur. Great purchase!! I would definitely buy it again!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Young

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Does what it promises. My dog had knots that were so bad, I was afraid we would have to shave them off. I bought this as a last resort and it worked. My dog moves a lot so it took a while but when she would actually stay still the comb would get them right out with no pulling. Would recommend for dogs who have fur that tangled easily.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Second tool for doodle mats
customer_reviews.text: Brush your dog wioth the hair's grain with a slicker brush first. When you find a mat, use the slicker brush against the grain. If that doesn't remove it, use this comb. Pick at the mat a little at a time until the comb cuts through it. Go back to the slicker brush and if there is still mat, use the Safari mat remover as the final tool.
customer_reviews.author: Robt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for thick coated dogs
customer_reviews.text: I've bought so many brushes to try and work thru my border collie's fur. This one beats all of them! So happy to finally found a comb that easily removes the mats and detangles. I joke around that this comb worked out three years of fur build-up! I could have made a small dog out of all the fur it cleaned up from her coat.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it as much as I do!
customer_reviews.text: I groom our three English Cocker Spanials and this tool makes de_matting so much easier on the dogs and me. The top serrated edge of the blades glide through matts without pulling too hard on their skin. I go over their entire coat with this tool first which gets rid of the matts and tangles. With those gone, they are far more comfortable and relaxed as I move to the stripping tools and clippers. I only wish that I found this a long time ago...
customer_reviews.author: go930turbo

customer_reviews.title: Great at getting hard to comb out matts from dog ...
customer_reviews.text: Great at getting hard to comb out matts from dog fur. My Malamute dog gets matts that normal slicker brush just won't get out. This tool works well to cut them out and make sure the fur in those areas doesn't get unmanageable to the point where it pulls at the dog's skin. The blades are very sharp, so be careful so that you don't cut your fingers or the dog. Easy to manage if your dog is fine getting brushed. Highly recommended and is very cost effective compared to many of the other brushes for sale here.
customer_reviews.author: GregTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Comb!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! It was very easy to use and worked great for my Aussiedoodle! His hair knots up very quickly and this comb went right through them all. The only downside I didn’t like is the fact that you can’t flip it over. You have to use it in one direction and maneuver your dog around to brush. Very small dislike though. I think it’s still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Sheepadoodle!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. I have a large Sheepadoodle who gets mats, esp at base of tail, elbows, and hips. This glided through the hair and broke up the mat with ease. Didn’t tug or upset my dog at all. Not sure why other reviews complained about cutting themselves on the serated side....thumb grip is plenty to control and smooth side goes against dogs skin. I am thrilled to have found this product.
customer_reviews.author: KRaum

customer_reviews.title: Chow Chow approved!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this comb! We have a Chow Chow and she gets mattes behind her ears like crazy! We have bought multiple combs for my dog to try and get mattes out. Nothing has worked until we bought this!! It’s blades are sharp enough to slice through the matte to help break it up.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron H.

customer_reviews.title: Miller forge slicker brush is awful
customer_reviews.text: Miller forge slicker brush is of horrible quality....been using them for over 30 years,,,newest brush purchased is cheaply made, lightweight plastic, very sharp bristles could injure dogs, will not use for fear of damaging dogs skin...
customer_reviews.author: Betty Schmidt Betty Canine Salon

customer_reviews.title: Best dog brush ever
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best dog grooming product we've ever purchased. Blows furminator out of the water for breaking up matting or just "sticky" fur. But the best part, no pulling for your pup! Our very curly goldendoodle dreaded grooming befor this brush. Now she sits patiently. It gets right to the undercoat and glides through breaking and cutting the matting. Buy this brush!!
customer_reviews.author: Andy U

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & detangles my Goldendoodle's fur very nicely
customer_reviews.text: This brush works wonders to detangle my Goldendoodle's fur! His coat is thick and he has large, loose curls. This thing combs right through the tangles without pulling out clumps of fur, and leaves the hair feeling very soft. The combs feel sturdy, and holds up to even the most thick/dense tangles he has. Yes, I would buy this product again, but quite honestly, won't need to because it is so durable, it seems like it'll last for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Crober

customer_reviews.title: Norweigen Forest cat fur defeats de-matting comb.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty sharp but it's simple not sharp enough, it doesn't easily cut through matted fur. It's difficult to work it between the matt and the skin, it pulls instead of slices and the cat hates it. This is my fifth tool to try and de-matt him but nothing works when he has his heavy winter coat. Wish there was something that would safely cut off the matts without the noise of a trimmer. He is such a scaredy-cat.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Works so well on even really bad mats!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I have a great pyrenees and he's getting on, almost 14 years old. We have to groom him ourselves because he can't stand too long and we groom him so we can do a little bit every day. His tail had gotten so matted. This comb is great. He doesn't mind it and I just go slow but he doesn't flinch one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found
customer_reviews.text: Between sand burrs, cockle burrs, sticktites, etc. our inside dogs seem to pickup something every time they go outside. While they do not particularly enjoy the process of being groomed they object less with this tool. Just remember to gently pull the tool through the hair and not be too aggressive with it. Take your time, let the tool do the work.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Works!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was so surprised that this cut through my labradoodle's massive mats. My old labradoodle was a breeze to groom. Our new lady friend is not. She has a ton of hair and it is silky, super curly, and mats like mad. This is not the end all be all for grooming-- you will still have to cut those mats out eventually-- but it makes them smaller, less unsightly, and less painful for the pup. Our dog _almost_ didn't mind me combing them, which is highly unusual. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mav

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for removing knots
customer_reviews.text: I have a long-hard dog (Coton de Tulear) who tends to get knots. This tool is great for cutting through and gently removing these knots. Typically I will use this tool first and then follow up with a comb and brush. Reasonably priced and well worth the investment. Also better than having to shave your dog if knots become to pervasive.
customer_reviews.author: StripedGoggles

customer_reviews.title: I've had this brush for almost a year and love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Alaskan Malamute, and a Great Pyrenees. This brush has done the most awesome work on my Pyr's coat and my Mally's Woolly hair. I would definitely recommend for breeds with very long hair .. Both of my two have hair over 7" in most areas. Works amazingly on their matting .. I have noticed that it is not as sharp now after a year. I will be buying another soon!
customer_reviews.author: MCarr

customer_reviews.title: Love this miracle tool.
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly this really works. Now I just need to get my dog to sit and stay while I try to brush her. She's 6 lbs of fury. Always hated being brushed. However, this gets right through all the matts and knots and tangled fur. So, brushing her out takes less than half the time it would with whatever else I've been using. They're tiny blades so you have to be careful not to cut the dog and always make sure they're facing away from them.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki W.

customer_reviews.title: This works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1.5 yr old wheaten terrier who is in the worst coat stage they have. I have about 6 months left of this coat and it will get easier, but in the meantime, she mats ALL THE TIME. This mat cutter works very well. My wheaten did not flinch or try to get away while using this tool, so it's obviously cutting right through the mat. This tool will cut down my brush/combing time so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far works great.
customer_reviews.text: Have a long haired dog that gets mats and dreads really fast if we don't brush often. This rake is really great at cutting through the mats and breaking up the dreads. It is basically a bunch of serrated knife blades with rounded points. You can push the blades through the mats then gently pull up with a sawing motion and they cut with very little effort. The thumb guard give good positioning and control.
customer_reviews.author: bdprime

customer_reviews.title: Springerdoodle
customer_reviews.text: This comb is by far the best that I have found to comb the hair on my springerdoodle. It does not pull or tug, she does not mind being combed and it goes through tangles/matts better than anything else I have tried. I did cut myself a little the first time I used it so hold it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: ptiche

customer_reviews.title: Great tool if you know how to use
customer_reviews.text: Note that this tool can injure a dog if not used properly -- it is sharp and can pull too hard on intact mats. If you know how to use it to tease out mats it's great. It's also possible to slice the ends of your fingers if you grab the blades, which is why it comes with a cover for the blades. If you are new to the tool ask your groomer or other experienced person to show you how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Think First

customer_reviews.title: Sorta works
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend thinks it pulls, but I don't think it's that bad. My powder puff chinese crested doesn't seem to mind it too much more than she minds her regular brush. That said, the blades aren't that sharp and you do sort of have to saw through the mats. My main gripe is that the blades are too far apart to get all the little mats. A lot of them just slip right through.
customer_reviews.author: Maren

customer_reviews.title: Safe, comfortable, and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I've used similar products, but this is certainly my favorite. Fits in my hand so comfortably. Although the blades are sharp I have no trouble keeping myself and more importantly the pup that I am grooming safe at all times. Of course this is NOT a tool that should be used for all mats on just any part of the body. This tool is great for getting mats out while keeping the dog comfortable and getting a more unnoticeable, natural finish after the mat has been broken apart/ removed.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla Ralston

customer_reviews.title: Don't try to use on fidgety, restless dogs, it's razor sharp.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Bernedoodle whose fur is a grooming nightmare, matts reproduce overnight! We wanted to try to avoid cutting his hair. The de matting tool works well, but on really tight matts you have to work it back and forth in a sawing motion. Have to take care that your hands are completely dry, even though the tool has a thumb guard it can still slip and give you a nasty cut. I think that we got the tool too late in the matting process as we had our dog shaved down in the end. But we are still well impressed with the tool.
customer_reviews.author: fiona donovan

customer_reviews.title: Great Comb!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cocker Spaniel with long hair and we live near the woods- he is forever getting into weeds or briars. With this comb, I can easily detangle anything! He tends to matt easily and this comb helps to get them out better than anything I have ever tried, and I have tried a lot of products! It's not painful for my dog if I use it gently and sort of rock it back and forth in a sawing motion as I am getting the matts out. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Super dangerous!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on my dogs hair, but did work on slashing my skin open, and I’m a genetic hemophiliac that’s on blood thinners. Thanks for almost killing me!!
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Oh, this thing is wonderful. I have a Black Russian Terrier (curly and hard thick coat) and I tell you it is hard almost impossible to comb his hair without hurting him. The mats build up in no matter of time. This de-matting comb helps a lot, my dog even likes it sometimes to be combed and he tolerates only this particular comb (and we have a lot of them). By the way, it is the second Safari De-matting Comb, the first one "served" us for about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: margret

customer_reviews.title: I would and have recommend this products for mats on cat or dog.
customer_reviews.text: This de-matting comb works great. I like that one side is smooth so it can lay next to the animal without hurting it. The other side is like a razor that cuts through the mat. Sometimes it takes a little work of moving the sharp side back and forth in a cutting motion to cut through the mat. It doesn't take as much hair out as if cutting the mat off with scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a brush to get out mats behind my golden retrievers ears. This did an amazing job, I just wish the teeth were a little closer together because it was harder to get the smaller mats. It did a great job either way and I'm very happy I dont have to cut out the mats anymore.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJean

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly and easily!
customer_reviews.text: Love this comb! My chihuahua/yorkie mix pupper has long,superfine hair which mats very quickly. I used to have to cut the mats out with scissors as combing them out was too annoying and painful fir my baby.This comb with just a minimal use,removes the mats but leaves his long gorgeous hair unharmed.Definitely just as advertised and worth it!
customer_reviews.author: The Raine

customer_reviews.title: Stops matting fast
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever. I have dogs with high maintenance fur and they often start matting within days of brushing. This brush has made it possible for my to cut through the knots before it can get too bad and make brushing after so much more gentler for my pups. Its changed everything and i wish I had this brush a long time ago. Makes a huge difference
customer_reviews.author: RogueRain

product_meta.title: Safari Dog De-Matting Comb, Stainless Steel with Soft Handle, (1-Pack)
product_meta.description: The Safari Dog De-Matting Comb removes mats and tangles from your dog's coat. The stainless steel, serrated blades will comb out most tangles. The De-Matting Comb can be used on most medium to long-haired dogs. It is especially helpful on coarse or long, matted coats. This comb has a soft handle with dual thumb grips that allow you to comfortably remove mats and tangles. The stainless steel, serrated blades are designed to avoid contact with the dog's skin. (1-Pack)
feature_bullets: 1-Pack Safari Dog De-Matting Comb made of Stainless Steel with soft handle.
Designed to easily remove mats and tangles from coarse or long, matted coats.
The stainless steel, serrated blades will comb out most tangles.
The De-Matting Comb can be used on most medium to longhaired dogs.
Removes mats and tangles from your dog's matted coat.
Suitable for use on breeds with medium to longhaired coats
Especially helpful for coarse or long, matted coats
Blades can be reversed for right or left handed use
Always comb in the direction of the hair growth

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
